content: This usually happens due to folder re-sync issues, server-side changes, account reconfiguration, or profile inconsistencies in Thunderbird. In many cases, emails are not permanently deleted, but the folder is no longer visible or mapped correctly. When system folders like Deleted / Trash disappear, Thunderbird may stop syncing those emails correctly. If the issue isn’t addressed early, users can lose access to emails that still exist in backups or archives. If the Deleted folder has vanished and emails are no longer accessible through Thunderbird, BitRecover Thunderbird Converter provides a safe alternative to bring back previously stored or archived mailbox data directly into Thunderbird, without relying on server synchronization.

Message Pane area when there are several messages selected or contents of a thread.

content:
You can't always get what you want. One click? Not that I know of. But three clicks, yes.

- Use your infallible filter rule to first tag the messages it catches with a custom tag; then delete them. The filter will execute every time Thunderbird gets New Mail.

- Create a separate rule that will Delete only messages with your custom tag. This rule can be manually run (Tools | Run Filters on Folder) against the Trash folder as often as you wish. This will forever delete them from this universe but leave all other messages in Trash;

1. One click to select the Trash folder;

2. One click to choose menu item Tools;

3. One click to choose Run Filters on Folder

or key combination Alt - T - R to execute steps 2 and 3.
